intro: Meconopsis lancifolia subsp. lancifolia, commonly known as the lancleaved meconopsis, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is a sought-after plant in horticulture.
